column4: I need to download a driver for an ati sapphire x1650 on a laptop that doesn't have that video card in it...so I can install it in a computer that has no internet access.
AMD/ATI has driver dropped support for pre-HD2000 cards long ago.
The pre-HD2000s are supported only by the open source driver ("radeon"). For further support you might want to use the dedicated #radeon channel.
I just need any driver that will work...even if its the open source drivers...will ubuntu recognize it if I plug that video card in without putting it on the internet?
Yes, because the open spurce drivers are already a part of the system.
will the system driver allow me to get a resolution above 1024x768?  Because the Geforce 4 thats in it, I have a hard time doing that....thats why I scavenged this video card, lol
It should, but you won't know untill you try.
gotcha....do I need to do anything with the system before I put the new video card in?  like disable the onboard video card?
that sounds promising.  I hope it ends up beign that easy
I do have a tougher question...
is there a way to get routine updates to an offline computer?
It might be a good idea. Anyways, what's this onboard card?
the onboard card is a geforce 4 mx and I can't get the video to stay right
The only good think I can think about is connecting it to web, from time to time.
yeah, I thought about that...its really a pain to get it out of the church though, lol
I've used aptoncd to get software to it, but never updates...
Switching to Radeon, especialy pre-HD2000, is not a really good idea either, since it's a real russian roulette.
well, the church can't really afford a new machine right now.
we dont really have much of a choice...I have to get something working better.
the geforce 4 screen is all off...it only detects 1024x768 and even that is offset with a weird wrapping effect on the edges of the screen
and the cursor doesn't line up.
I've tried adding modelines, and they don't work on bootup

Radeons are famous for not working very well under X.org, due to problematic drivers (both open source and proprietary). I it's an AGP board, something like 7300GT + proprietary nVidia drivers would be a much better choice, since nVidia's famous for working very well with X.
For this X1650 best go to the #radeon channel
